intro: Bumelia oblongata, commonly known as the narrowleaf bumelia, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features opposite, elliptic to oblong leaves that are typically 3–6 inches long. Its flowers are clustered in small, greenish-yellow cyathia, which are characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Bumelia oblongata is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
